context_of_use: This use case allows administrators to manage user accounts and control system access within the application.
stakeholders_and_interests: admin: Control system access and manage user accounts.
description: Enable administrators to manage user accounts and control system access.
triggering_event: Admin requests to manage user accounts.
preconditions: Admin is authenticated and authorized to manage user accounts.
postconditions: User accounts are successfully managed and system access is controlled.
assumptions: The admin has the necessary permissions to manage user accounts.
requirements_met: The system shall allow administrators to manage user accounts.
The system shall ensure that only authorized users can access user management features.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the specific user management functionalities required.
main_flow: 1. Admin requests to manage user accounts → System displays user management interface.
2. Admin selects a user account to manage → System retrieves and displays user account details.
3. Admin updates user account information → System saves changes and confirms the update.
4. Admin logs out → System terminates the session.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If the admin is not authenticated, then the system denies access and prompts for login.
